Macros

#define adjacent(A, B)   (((A) == (B)) || (((A) + 1) == (B)) || ((B) == 0))
 Timer read workaround: Do count values differ by one tick or less. More...
 
#define CTXPADNUM(ctx)   ((CTx_tbl[ctx] >> 0) & 0x3f)
 
#define CTXPADFNC(ctx)   ((CTx_tbl[ctx] >> 8) & 0x7)
 
#define CTX(pad, fn)   ((fn << 8) | (pad << 0))
 
#define OUTC(timB, timN, N2)   ((N2 << 4) | (timB << 3) | (timN << 0))
 
#define OUTCTIMN(ctx, n)   (outcfg_tbl[ctx][n] & (0x7 << 0))
 
#define OUTCTIMB(ctx, n)   (outcfg_tbl[ctx][n] & (0x1 << 3))
 
#define OUTCO2(ctx, n)   (outcfg_tbl[ctx][n] & (0x1 << 4))
 
#define AM_APOLLO3_CTIMER   1
 
#define CTIMERADDRn(periph, n, reg)
 
#define CTIMERn(n)   ((CTIMER_Type*)(CTIMER_BASE + (n * ((uint32_t)&CTIMER->TMR1 - (uint32_t)&CTIMER->TMR0))))

These macros may be used to set and clear interrupt bits

Configuration options

Configuration options for am_hal_ctimer_config_t

These options are to be used with the am_hal_ctimer_config_t structure used by am_hal_ctimer_config

#define AM_HAL_CTIMER_CLK_PIN   _VAL2FLD(CTIMER_CTRL0_TMRA0CLK, 0x00)
 
#define AM_HAL_CTIMER_HFRC_12MHZ   _VAL2FLD(CTIMER_CTRL0_TMRA0CLK, 0x01)
 
#define AM_HAL_CTIMER_HFRC_3MHZ   _VAL2FLD(CTIMER_CTRL0_TMRA0CLK, 0x02)

Detailed Description

Macro Definition Documentation

◆ adjacent

#define adjacent (   A,
  B 
)    (((A) == (B)) || (((A) + 1) == (B)) || ((B) == 0))

Timer read workaround: Do count values differ by one tick or less.

◆ AM_APOLLO3_CTIMER

#define AM_APOLLO3_CTIMER   1

◆ AM_HAL_CTIMER_ADC_TRIG

◆ AM_HAL_CTIMER_AUX4_TMRB4TRIG_STIMERCAP0

#define AM_HAL_CTIMER_AUX4_TMRB4TRIG_STIMERCAP0   CTIMER_AUX4_TMRB4TRIG_A7OUT

Timer trigger options for Apollo3 Blue (rev B0 and later) including Apollo3 Blue Plus.

Valid only for CTIMER4 and CTIMER5 when CTLINK==1 and TMRA4TRIG==1

◆ AM_HAL_CTIMER_FN_CONTINUOUS

#define AM_HAL_CTIMER_FN_CONTINUOUS   _VAL2FLD(CTIMER_CTRL0_TMRA0FN, 6)

Continuous: Free running timer with a single level change on the output and a single optional interrupt.

◆ AM_HAL_CTIMER_FN_ONCE

#define AM_HAL_CTIMER_FN_ONCE   _VAL2FLD(CTIMER_CTRL0_TMRA0FN, 0)

Timer function macros. Single Count: Counts one time to the compare value, then the output changes polarity and stays at that level, with an optional interrupt.

◆ AM_HAL_CTIMER_FN_PTN_ONCE

#define AM_HAL_CTIMER_FN_PTN_ONCE   _VAL2FLD(CTIMER_CTRL0_TMRA0FN, 4)

Single Pattern: one burst of bits specified by the CMPR0/1/2/3 registers.

◆ AM_HAL_CTIMER_FN_PTN_REPEAT

#define AM_HAL_CTIMER_FN_PTN_REPEAT   _VAL2FLD(CTIMER_CTRL0_TMRA0FN, 5)

Repeated Pattern: repeated burst of bits specified by the CMPR0/1/2/3 registers.

◆ AM_HAL_CTIMER_FN_PWM_ALTERNATE

#define AM_HAL_CTIMER_FN_PWM_ALTERNATE   _VAL2FLD(CTIMER_CTRL0_TMRA0FN, 7)

Alternate Pulse: like Repeated Pulse but alternating between two different pulse width/spacing settings.

◆ AM_HAL_CTIMER_FN_PWM_ONCE

#define AM_HAL_CTIMER_FN_PWM_ONCE   _VAL2FLD(CTIMER_CTRL0_TMRA0FN, 2)

Single Pulse (One Shot): A single pulse of programmed width, with an optional interrupt.

◆ AM_HAL_CTIMER_FN_PWM_REPEAT

#define AM_HAL_CTIMER_FN_PWM_REPEAT   _VAL2FLD(CTIMER_CTRL0_TMRA0FN, 3)

Repeated Pulse: A rectangular (or square) waveform with programmed high and low widths, and optional interrupts on each cycle.

◆ CTIMERADDRn

#define CTIMERADDRn (   periph,
  n,
  reg 
)
Value:
( periph##_BASE + \
offsetof(periph##_Type, reg) + \
(n * (offsetof(periph##_Type, TMR1) - offsetof(periph##_Type, TMR0))) )

CTIMERADDRn() This is a specialized version of AM_REGADDRn(). It is necessary because the CTIMER does not work as a multi-module peripheral. In typical multi-module peripherals, the base address is defined as MODULE0_BASE. For CTIMER it's CTIMER_BASE (there is no module 0 defined).

Usage: CTIMER_ADDRn(CTIMER, n, reg).

periph: Must always be CTIMER. n: The timer number specified as a macro, variable, etc. reg: The register name always ending in '0'. E.g. TMR0, CTRL0, CMPRB0, etc (regardless of the timernum specified by 'n').

◆ CTIMERn

#define CTIMERn (   n)    ((CTIMER_Type*)(CTIMER_BASE + (n * ((uint32_t)&CTIMER->TMR1 - (uint32_t)&CTIMER->TMR0))))

CMSIS-Style macro for handling a variable CTIMER module number.

◆ CTX

#define CTX (   pad,
  fn 
)    ((fn << 8) | (pad << 0))

◆ CTXPADFNC

#define CTXPADFNC (   ctx)    ((CTx_tbl[ctx] >> 8) & 0x7)

◆ CTXPADNUM

#define CTXPADNUM (   ctx)    ((CTx_tbl[ctx] >> 0) & 0x3f)

◆ OUTC

#define OUTC (   timB,
  timN,
  N2 
)    ((N2 << 4) | (timB << 3) | (timN << 0))

◆ OUTCO2

#define OUTCO2 (   ctx,
  n 
)    (outcfg_tbl[ctx][n] & (0x1 << 4))

◆ OUTCTIMB

#define OUTCTIMB (   ctx,
  n 
)    (outcfg_tbl[ctx][n] & (0x1 << 3))

◆ OUTCTIMN

#define OUTCTIMN (   ctx,
  n 
)    (outcfg_tbl[ctx][n] & (0x7 << 0))

◆ am_hal_ctimer_int_enable_get()

uint32_t am_hal_ctimer_int_enable_get ( void  )

Return the enabled timer interrupts.

This function will return all enabled interrupts in the main CTIMER interrupt enable register.

Returns
return enabled interrupts. This will be a logical or of:
  • AM_REG_CTIMER_INTEN_CTMRAxC0INT_M
  • AM_HAL_CTIMER_INT_TIMERAxC1,
